h2.a: Information to Help Children Deal with Coronavirus

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-223b39b elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.h1:
Columbia Falls High School facility was built in 1959. It is located near the south-central part of town a few blocks north of the Flathead River and four blocks south of US Highway 2, the main east-west thoroughfare through town.
The original CFHS campus was designed to accommodate 650 students in the main building and administration offices in the CFHS Annex. Additions and renovations took place in 1990, when an academic wing of seven classrooms was added.
In 1995, the Industrial Tech area was expanded to accommodate additional classroom and shop space. The main high school building and the annex houses classrooms and activity space for over 850 students.

div.h2: Our mission is to provide a quality education through shared responsibility in a safe supportive environment for all students to meet the challenges of a global society.

div.h2:
Good afternoon parents and staff of Columbia Falls,
The Columbia Falls School Board has tentatively set a digital board meeting for Wednesday, April 29, at 6:00 PM. By Wednesday morning you will be able to find on our website information that will allow you to electronically participate in the meeting.
After listening to Flathead County Health Department Officials, conferring with school superintendents across the valley, and talking with our administrative staff, I will be recommending to the Board that the safest option for the remainder of the school year will be to continue with remote/online learning and to not reopen our schools.
Please understand I'm aware of the hardship this places on many of our families. However, I strongly believe that if we have any hope of having a normal school opening next fall we need to continue following the guidelines set forth by federal, state, and county health officials.
Our number one priority remains the health and safety of our students, staff, and community.
Sincerely,
Steve Bradshaw
Superintendent
Columbia Falls School District #6

div.h3:
FERPA
Family Education Rights and Privacy Act

h2.a:
SENIORS - PLEASE READ AND THEN CLICK for SCHOLARSHIPS
Most scholarships have been uploaded to our website by each month they are due. However, please note that some grantors have not yet been in touch with Mrs. Kaps and due to the timely nature of scholarships, she has elected to post what is available. Keep checking for new scholarship postings. Also, if you are using Google docs please make sure you mark to share with everyone.
Thank you!
